name: Best Slow Cooked Corned Beef and Cabbage
ingredientLines: 4 large carrots, peeled and cut into matchstick pieces
1 (4 pound) corned beef brisket with Corned Beef Spice Packet
10 small potatoes, quartered (I grow my own using these!)
6 ounces beer (I love Guinness. Save the rest for cabbage dish or guzzle... Your choice!)
1 onion, peeled and cut into bite-sized pieces
2 heads of organic Green Cabbage (cut into 16 wedges)
100% Organic Extra Virgin Cold-Pressed Olive Oil (for searing cabbage)
The other 1/2 of the bottle of Guinness (or a new one after you finished the other)

In the last 30 minutes, before brisket is finished, make the balsamic reduction for the cabbage. Stir balsamic and sugar in a small saucepan over medium-high heat. Stir together and bring to a boil. Reduce to medium-low and simmer until the glaze is reduced by half and syrupy thick.

Warm oven to 350 degrees. Cut the cabbage into 16 wedges (leaving a portion of stem to hold cabbage together nicely). Heat the olive oil in a Large Pre-Seasoned Cast-Iron Skillet over medium-high heat and add the wedges. Sear it on both sides, until the cabbage gets as green as possible, about 1 minute per side. Use a spatula to move cabbage to a rack placed over a baking sheet. Sprinkle the cabbage pieces with salt and pepper. Pour the other half of your Guinness (or any other beer) into the bottom of the pan and carefully transfer the pan to the oven. Bake the cabbage for 20 minutes, or until golden brown.
